text:
XML-style JSP tags, such as <jsp:scriptlet>code</jsp:scriptlet> or 
<jsp:expression>expr</jsp:expression> are not supported by Jasper. I have read 
several popular books that, like the JSP specifications, list those tags as part 
of the JSP standard.

I checked the most recent version of Jasper, and that support is not there.
The reason to use XML-style tags is that it makes the code easier to format 
using, for example, Emacs in xsl-mode. The indentation of nested tags is handled 
automatically with XML-style tags.

I have a custom version of org/apache/jasper/compiler/Parser.java that 
is extended to support the <jsp:scriptlet> </jsp:scriptlet> syntax in addition 
to the default <% %>. The required changes are localized only to Parser.java 
file. It took me about 15 minutes to do it, but would take under 5 for the next 
one (or for someone who is familiar with the code.) Please, e-mail me if you 
would like a copy of my changes (or to yell at me if you think I shouldn't have 
posted this bug.)
